DOC.brief_title: Diabetes Incentive Performance Study ( DIPS ) Shanghai Jiading District
DOC.detailed_description: Methods： This study open- label control randomized cluster trial invite eligible physician patient attend study . These physician work health community center Shanghai Jiading district patient district community . Each physician care monitor least 20 patient . This serve cluster randomize unit . The study size consist 40 unit within Jiading District Shanghai . Samples take patient accord preset schedule measure patient ' level HbA1c accordingly . The physician recruit patient meet criterion Jiading Study Standard . All patient establish health record physicians community health center . To enrolled patient , study obtain information demographic characteristic , diagnosis treatment , complication , various biochemical index , skill capacity disease self-management , etc . Biomarkers genetic risk factor evaluate study subject . The study also give several training course enrol physician patient , need meet study criterion sign inform consent participate study . The study use method randomize complete block design classify enrol unit 4 group . Group 1- Physicians ; Group 2 - Patients ; Group 3 - Both Physicians Patients , Group 4 - control . Groups 1-3 receive incentive obtain or/and maintain ideal level Hemoglobin A1c ( HbA1c ) 3-years study period . We aim achieve target HbA1c < 7 % reduce 0.5 % HbA1c level annually 3 year study period . The incentive form cash value award . The amount incentive increase annually depend upon change HbA1c . The award serve motivation factor token reward desire self-discipline disease management enhance self-efficacy . The control group receive incentive provide diabetes education booklet group education course DM control usual . The study use exist tele-medicine system monitor patient ' blood pressure blood glucose remotely . The system telemedicine also provide series diabetes education training course support physician patient diabetes treatment , care self-management disease . The study document change patient ' blood pressure , biochemical index , medication , quality life , self-management skill diabetes , life behavior , complication cost .
